column4: my disk utility shows i have 3 partitions. one wld be for ubuntu, another for windows, and the last is (i guess) my free disk space. windows crashed hard on me and i want to just format it off my drive. how do i know which  partition is windows
better yet, how useful is this channel?

my disk utility shows i have 3 partitions. one wld be for ubuntu, another for windows, and the last is (i guess) my free disk space. windows crashed hard on me and i want to just format it off my drive. how do i know which  partition is windows
try gparted, look for NTFS and/or Fat32 partition. That's windows
wouldn't make much sense - Linux is always Ext2/3 filesystem, plus a swap space.
